_header: Through ferly death together aren folde
_description:
On sudden death, a tag in the Fasciculus morum — two couplets translating ‘the punning speeches of the Parisian literati’ (Wenzel (1978)
XWenzel, Siegfried. Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle English Poems. Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978, 171)

Bod187.Transcription:
þorow ferly deþ to gederys arn faldeboþe yvyl lyf
                    & yvyl deþ þat buþ caldy rede suche lyf þu
                    forsakeWith suche deþ left þu be y take

Bod410.Transcription:
Thorw sodayn deth be hennes caldEuyl lyf and euyl deth faldEuyl
                    lyf than we forsakeLest euyl deth vs hen take
Bod410.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 170.

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
thurgh sodayn deth he hennes Caldeuel liff and euel deþe
                    falsEuyl liff þen we for sakelest euel deþe vs henne
                    take
BodLauMis213.Note:
Written as prose, two couplets separated by Latin, ‘Et alius
                    rundit’.

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Þourgh ferly deth to-gedur arn faldBothe euel lyf & euel
                    deth caldI rede such lyf þou forsakeWyth suche deth lest þou
                    be take
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 170.

CamGon71.Transcription:
Thorow ferly dede to gedder ere falneboth euel lyue & yuel dede
                    calneI rede swylk lyue þu for sakeWith swylk dede þu be
                    take
CamGon71.Note: Two couplets, separated by Latin prose.

EDU82.Transcription:
Thorowe ferly dethe to geder arn faldeBothe yuell lyfe and yuell
                    dethe ycaldeI rede suche lyfe thou forsakeWyth suche dethe lest thou
                    be take

Lincoln44.Transcription:
þorwe ferly deþ to geder arn faldeboþ yuel lyfe and
                    yuil y calde

Spalding.First Lines:
Þoruȝ ferly dede to gedyr is falleuyll lyff & euyll
                    dede cald…
Spalding.Last Lines:
…I Rede sech life be forsakeWyth sech deyde lest þu be
                    take
Spalding.Note:
Two couplets separated by Latin prose text; written as
                    prose.

WorcF19.Transcription:
þorw ferly deþ to geder arn faldy rede sich lif þow
                    forsake with suche deth lest þu be take
WorcF19.Note:
2 x 2 separated, here second line missing, written as
                    prose.
